value.title: Nigeria Set to Pass Sweeping AI Rules for Digital Economy
value.content: Nigeria is set to pass a law that would place it among the first African countries to regulate artificial intelligence, tightening oversight of one of the continent’s fastest-growing digital markets after years of largely unchecked expansion by global technology firms.

value.title: Baidu CFO on Business Strategy, AI Investments
value.content: Henry He, CFO at Baidu, discusses the company’s business strategy and its investments in AI. He speaks with Stephen Engle from the sidelines of the UBS Greater China Conference in Shanghai. (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: SK Hynix to Build $13 Billion AI Memory Chip Packaging Plant
value.content: SK Hynix Inc. plans to spend 19 trillion won ($12.9 billion) building a new advanced chip packaging facility, kicking off a major expansion aimed at meeting surging demand from AI applications.

value.title: GigaDevice Jumps 54% in Hong Kong After $600 Million Listing
value.content: GigaDevice Semiconductor Inc. shares rose in its Hong Kong debut, underscoring growing investor interest in Chinese stocks related to artificial intelligence.

value.title: Trump Says Tech Giants Must Bear Cost of Data Center Electricity
value.content: President Donald Trump, addressing American voter concerns about rising electricity prices, said his administration had been in talks with Microsoft Corp. to ensure that consumers “don’t pick up the tab” for enormous data centers.

value.title: Medtronic and Neuralink Rival Precision Form Partnership
value.content: Medtronic Plc is partnering with brain implant company Precision Neuroscience Corp. in a deal that will give the medical device maker access to neural data it can use to develop new products.

value.title: Stocks Rise as Credit Card Shares Slip on Trump Rate Cap Talk | The Close 1/12/2026
value.content: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. Today's guests are Former Federal Reserve Governor Betsy Duke, GE HealthCare’s Peter Arduini, CFRA’s Ken Leon, Zoetis’ Kristin Peck, Morgan Stanley’s Lauren Hochfelder, Blackrock’s Jay Jacobs, Cornell University’s Eswar Prasad, PGIM’s Cathy Marcus, Elanco Animal Health’s Jeff Simmons, Pfizer’s Albert Bourla. (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Meta Hires Trump Ally Powell McCormick to Drive AI Buildout
value.content: Meta Platforms Inc. has appointed a former top adviser to US President Donald Trump to a newly created senior management role focused on partnering with governments and investors on AI.

value.title: Apple Picks Gemini to Run AI-Powered Siri  | Bloomberg Tech 1/12/2026
value.content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss Apple’s decision to use Alphabet’s Gemini to power Siri in a multiyear deal. Plus, Nvidia plans to invest $1 billion over five years in a new lab with Eli Lilly & Co. to speed up the use of AI in the pharmaceutical industry. And, Paramount sues Warner Bros. Discovery and plans to nominate directors to the board, stepping up hostilities in its takeover efforts.  (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Musk Moves Back Into Trump Orbit
value.content: Elon Musk appears to be getting closer to President Donald Trump again. He'll be speaking at an event with Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth. The political panel on Balance of Power discusses. (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: EV, Self-Driving Competition Kicks Into Higher Gear in 2026
value.content: The car market is undergoing changes as Nvidia makes a push into self-driving and EU regulators consider replacing tariffs on Chinese EVs with minimum pricing. Stephanie Valdez Streaty, director of industry insights for Cox Automotive, discusses the latest news and expectations for the car industry with Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Meta Plans to Cut 10% of Jobs at Company’s Reality Labs Division
value.content: Meta Platforms Inc. plans to cut 10% of jobs in the company’s Reality Labs division, part of a broader strategy to shift money away from some virtual reality products and into other AI wearables.

value.title: GE Healthcare CEO on Threats From AI
value.content: Peter Arduini, CEO of GE Healthcare, talks about the risks of using artificial intelligence, but he says the technology is a breakthrough for healthcare. He speaks to Katie Greifeld at the JPMorgan Healthcare Conference in San Francisco.  (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Alphabet’s Rise to $4 Trillion Cements Status as AI Trade Winner
value.content: Alphabet Inc. broke above a $4 trillion market capitalization on Monday, becoming one of the few companies to ever cross the threshold as investors increasingly see the Google parent as one of the biggest winners of the artificial intelligence boom.

value.title: Nvidia to Invest $1 Billion in AI Drug Lab With Eli Lilly
value.content: Nvidia plans to invest $1 billion over five years in a new laboratory with Eli Lilly & Co., in an effort to speed up the use of AI in the pharmaceutical industry. Denny Fish, portfolio manager on the Global Technology and Innovation Team at Janus Henderson Investors, joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: New AI Model Lets Robot Neo Learn Tasks From Scratch
value.content: Humanoid maker 1X Technologies has introduced a new AI model that it says allows its home robot Neo to perform new tasks from a video or voice prompt even if the robot has zero experience doing the task before. 1X Technologies CEO and CTO Bernt Børnich joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on “Bloomberg Tech.” (Source: Bloomberg)

value.title: Meta Deals Need $14 Billion in New Reactors, BloombergNEF Says
value.content: Next-generation nuclear companies Oklo Inc. and TerraPower LLC will need to invest more than $14 billion in new reactors to support Meta Platforms Inc. data centers, according to estimates from BloombergNEF.

value.title: Paramount Launches Warner Bros. Proxy Fight, Files Suit
value.content: Paramount Skydance Corp. ratcheted up the stakes in the monthslong battle for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., saying it plans to nominate directors to the board to thwart a merger with Netflix Inc.

value.title: Apple, Google Confirm Multiyear Deal for AI Technology, Siri
value.content: Alphabet Inc.’s Google confirmed that it has entered a multiyear deal with Apple Inc. to power the iPhone maker’s artificial intelligence technology, including the Siri voice assistant.

value.title: How Discord’s IPO Will Test App’s Freewheeling Culture
value.content: Teens’ favorite chat app is planning an initial public offering.
